jobs.title: Lead Product Manager, Android Performance and Frameworks
jobs.responsibilities:
• Lead the success of projects from discovery to launch.
  • Collaborate with engineering, design, and marketing; maintain and manage a joint product roadmap with original equipment manufacturers.
  • Identify new areas for growth through quantitative search and UX studies.
  • Serve as the representative of the product within Google, and act as the point of contact for leadership.
  • Influence stakeholders across our organization to align intent and prioritization.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of product management experience with technical products.
  • Experience driving elements of the product development lifecycle such as product vision, go-to-market strategy, driving requirements, and product launch.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Engineering, User Experience (UX)/User Interface (UI), Program Management, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to pivot focus and projects quickly and thrive in ambiguity.
  • Knowledge of current technologies and services of related products.
  • Innovative thinker who is comfortable with collaboration, ambiguity, and solving large problems.
  • Interest in the mobile industry and working with a diverse ecosystem of partners.

address_lines: Google Building GWC1, 2025 Garcia Ave, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA

jobs.description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

As a Lead Product Manager for Android, you will have the opportunity to set the rules of resource management for Android. You will design an experience that balances performance and functionality, and decide policies for various special cases. You will get to interface with both phone manufactures and developers to implement your ideas.

Google aims to build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. The end goal will be to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, experience, and where you will have the most impact.

jobs.summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of product management experience with technical products.
  • Experience driving elements of the product development lifecycle such as product vision, go-to-market strategy, driving requirements, and product launch.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Engineering, User Experience (UX)/User Interface (UI), Program Management, etc.).

jobs.title: Regional Counsel
jobs.responsibilities:
• Draft and negotiate a wide range of commercial agreements across all product areas and functions.
  • Draft, negotiate, and lead to closure a variety of commercial agreements including bespoke agreements for novel/pilot products/projects, covering a wide range of activities. 
  • Conduct legal reviews of Google’s product, marketing, and sales initiatives and work in consultation with Google’s government affairs representatives to provide solution-oriented practical advice to facilitate launches and innovation.
  • Advise senior management and cross-functional project teams in Asia Pacific and USA with regard to various contractual covenants, potential legal risks, and ensure compliance with applicable laws across all aspects of Google’s operations in India.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • LL.B or comparable law degree and qualification to practice law in India.
  • Bar Qualified to practice in India.
  • 4 years of relevant experience within the commercial, intellectual property, media and technology areas.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with a law firm and as an in-house counsel in a Multinational Company, whether in India or overseas.
  • Established track record of successfully managing cross-functional teams on legal and/or non-legal related projects; demonstrated client management skills.
  • Familiarity with Internet technologies and related policy-regulatory environment.
  • Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of matters from the complex to the routine/standard ones.

address_lines: Hill Colony Rd, Viswash Nagar, Mehdipatnam, Hyderabad, Telangana 500028, India

jobs.description:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

  • Bar Qualified to practice in India.
  • 4 years of relevant experience within the commercial, intellectual property, media and technology areas.

jobs.title: Sales Intelligence Analyst, Online Partnerships Group
jobs.responsibilities:
• Implement technically intelligent sales campaigns on our customer management infrastructure with SQL scripting
  • Help manage a global program that delivers intelligent sales campaigns to thousands of publishers through partner managers across the globe
  • Collaborate with sales and product teams to identify opportunities for new campaigns
  • Engage with sales leaders to coordinate sales campaign activities and priorities
  • Analyze business growth performance of the intelligent campaigns over time
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience with SQL or another programming language

Preferred qualifications:

  • 1 year of practical experience in an analytical role
  • Experience with SQL or another programming language such as C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Java, and/or Python
  • Experience working with a mix of technical as well as non-technical sales teams and stakeholders
  • Experience with basic statistics

address_lines: Google Building GWC1, 2025 Garcia Ave, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA

jobs.description:
As a Sales Intelligence Analyst, you will be helping to manage an automated global program which identifies ways for Google’s Web, Video, and App content partners to make the most from our Google ads solutions. In this role, you will help design and deploy a portfolio of sales campaigns powered by automated data insights that enable our partner managers to identify the best way to help our partners’ businesses grow.

You will work with product and sales teams to identify opportunities for new campaigns, formulating how to utilize data to identify the best partners to pitch to, implementing these leads on our infrastructure using SQL, and helping to manage campaign performance in collaboration with our product experts.

You will build deep product and technology expertise in the digital content space, to develop project management skills, to develop advanced stakeholder management skills, to gain insight into sales operations, and to continue to grow technical skills in SQL and other technologies.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.
jobs.application_instruction: This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.

  • Experience with SQL or another programming language

jobs.title: Country Manager, Google Cloud (Vietnamese)
jobs.responsibilities:
• Lead and implement Vietnam go-to-market propositions in a given business sector, and work with Marketing, Demand Management, Solutions, Product, and Engineering teams to produce a focused proposition.
  • Build and maintain relationships in Vietnam Market to influence strategic direction and act as an advisor to the customer.
  • Work with Google Account teams to develop and drive pipeline and provide guidance, and work with Google Cloud Platform Partners to develop campaigns.
  • Collaborate with Sales Engineering and Marketing resources to provide input on current collateral materials and ideas on how to improve them and optimize Google Cloud Platform, and work towards strategic business goals.
  • Build a pipeline of customers within selected verticals in Vietnam market.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in an Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) and/or Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) sales role.
  • Ability to speak and write Vietnamese and English fluently, as this role covers our Vietnam business and you're expected to work with Vietnamese clients.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 12 years of field sales experience in the technology industry, promoting PaaS and/or IaaS.
  • 8 years of experience managing and leading a team.
  • Experience promoting cloud computing technologies to large and complex organizations across geographies.
  • Understanding of data and networking technologies, the global cloud computing market, and key drivers for growth in the chosen industry segment.
  • Understanding of how various cloud technologies work together to drive deeper technology adoption within the existing account base.
jobs.description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

jobs.title: Designer, Creative Lab
jobs.responsibilities:
• Partner to define and evolve Google's design and creative direction.
  • Conceive and create mold breaking design and communications across all mediums.
  • Work closely with marketing managers, writers, filmmakers, programmers, and producers to deliver great work in a scrappy environment.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Design, a related discipline, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience at a design firm/agency working on global brands.
  • Portfolio of original and breakthrough ideas.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Design, or a related discipline.
  • Experience working with technology to help create change.
  • Highly organized and ability to balance multiple simultaneous projects.
  • Advanced skill in InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop.
  • Smart, bold, and accessible sense of design.
  • Interest in world-changing leaps in technology, along with a healthy disrespect for the impossible.

address_lines: Six Pancras Square, 6 Pancras Square, London N1C 4AG, UK

jobs.description:
The Creative Lab is a small team of designers, writers, programmers, filmmakers, producers and business thinkers whose mission is to remind the world what it is they love about Google. Our job is to make Google’s magic more magical, help advance and invent Google’s future, and to communicate Google’s innovations, intentions and ideals in ways that makes us all immensely proud.

As a Designer, you'll help steward and extend the Google brand. In this role, you'll be expected to conceive and execute breakthrough ideas that will redefine how people think about the creative arts, in the same way Google itself has transformed technology.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
jobs.application_instruction: Please include URL(s) to an online portfolio in addition to your resume, as submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered. See tips on preparing for your design portfolio.

  • Experience at a design firm/agency working on global brands.
  • Portfolio of original and breakthrough ideas.

jobs.title: Program Manager, Control Tower Regional Lead
jobs.responsibilities:
• Standardize operational processes and reporting associated with capacity delivery performance and escalation.
  • Maintain situational awareness of high-priority areas, to strive for operational continuity, and meet customer expectations.
  • Facilitate business review, exception management, and escalations processes in support of defined operating performance goals.
  • Implement the global strategy and tactics to drive consistent on time delivery using operational data and situational awareness of the network delivery process within region.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in program management.
  • Experience in data networking architectures and physical network components.
  • Experience with deploying technical infrastructure at a global scale.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Project Management certification/ Six Sigma or Lean certification.
  • 5 years of experience managing cross-functional and/or cross-team projects.
  • Ability to build multiple strategic executive stakeholder relationships.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

address_lines: Google Building TC3, 805 11th Ave, Sunnyvale, CA 94089, USA

jobs.description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

The Control Tower function is responsible for delivering consistency with how we report, measure, prioritize, and escalate tactical actions to ensure customers’ needs are met. This includes the management of the appropriate reports and meetings with the goal of quickly understanding what is going on in the business and when escalation is required. The Control Tower will leverage the digitization of our end-to-end business processes and the telemetry this provides. Through this medium, the Control Tower will monitor global operations to identify where additional escalation or assistance may be required to keep work on track.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

jobs.title: Global Lifestyle Perks Program Manager, Workplace Experience
jobs.responsibilities:
• Help determine the strategy and goals of a global perks program, execute against that strategy, operate programs, and continually evolve our offerings to meet the needs of our growing and changing Googler population. 
  • Oversee the program’s budget and directly manage a vendor team responsible for delivering our global discount program, onsite convenience services, onsite events, and leisure activities programs. 
  • Manage relationships with external partners ranging from the travel industry to community arts groups, as well as with internal partners across Workplace Services, People Operations, Google’s global culture clubs, and our 'Googler-To-Googler' network.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Experience in program management
  • Experience in vendor management
  • Experience in stakeholder management
  • Experience in marketing communications

Preferred qualifications:

  • Track record of successfully translating corporate culture and employee needs into scalable global programs. Proven ability to use quantitative and qualitative data to inform program decisions at scale
  • Creative problem-solver, with the ability to think, plan, and execute on multiple projects and program offerings simultaneously
  • Ability to cultivate effective relationships, influence, and collaborate internally and externally at all organizational levels
  • Ability to thrive amidst ambiguity and reprioritize and adapt to the business' changing needs
  • Outstanding communication skills that capture Google's voice and culture across a range of channels and mediums

address_lines: Google Building TC3, 805 11th Ave, Sunnyvale, CA 94089, USA

jobs.description:
The Lifestyle Perks program helps Googlers disconnect from work and connect with their families, local communities, and other Googlers. Googlers are passionate about everything ranging from macrame to backcountry hiking. We organize and deliver curated events and services on campus, digitally, and throughout our local communities, and provide platforms for Googlers to share their passions.

In addition to fostering connections through the Google community, the Lifestyle Perks team also offers services to reduce everyday friction in Googlers’ lives via time and money savings. Our team manages Google’s robust corporate discount program, coordinates onsite amenities ranging from passport services to haircuts, and manages Google’s museum and sporting event ticket programs.

The Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS) team creates inspiring spaces and innovative services that bring Google’s culture and values to life. We build and maintain all aspects of what keeps our Googley workspaces operating seamlessly across multiple cities and regions globally. We also manage the industry-leading services that help make Google a great place to work -- from how we design healthy and collaborative workspaces, create energizing food experiences, provide convenient transportation and fitness options, to delivering inclusive environments where Google and our employees can thrive.

jobs.title: Associate Contracts Manager, Legal
jobs.responsibilities:
• Review, draft, discuss, and manage commercial agreements.
  • Advise business customers on the legal issues and risks, complex agreement structures, approval processes, and company policies and procedures.
  • Create and improve agreement templates, fallbacks, trainings, processes, and other resources.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience working with commercial agreements in a non-attorney role.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience drafting and partnering commercial agreements.
  • Ability to interpret legal documents, discuss agreements, review marketing materials, advise business and product managers on legal and regulatory issues, and work with attorneys to complete agreements and launch marketing initiatives.
  • Demonstrated organizational and communication skills.

address_lines: Six Pancras Square, 6 Pancras Square, London N1C 4AG, UK

jobs.description:
With a company growing at such fast speeds, every day another agreement is made to keep Google running. As a member of the Legal Contracts team, you review and revise contracts -- often juggling several at a time. You develop practical and innovative ways to meet Google's needs and keep the company thriving, with the ability to affect Google's long-term goals.

As an Associate Contracts Manager, you will work closely with various Google teams. You'll discuss and draft sponsorship agreements, co-marketing agreements, inbound services agreements, statements of work, and other legal documents. You'll advise the Google teams on agreement interpretation, risk assessment and mitigation, and partnering strategy. You'll also review materials, and work cross-functionally with Compliance, Finance, and other Legal teams to ensure we are meeting our legal obligations. In addition, you'll work on the development of internal fallbacks, training, and policies to guide cross-functional teams, improve efficiency, and provide support to the Legal Operations team.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

jobs.title: Strategic Outreach and Engagement Manager
jobs.responsibilities:
• Support the GAPP team in executing a strategy for consistent and meaningful engagement with key stakeholders (e.g., policymakers, think tanks, non-governmental organizations, academics, business customers, industry leaders, etc.).
  • Support the GAPP team in developing cross-functional partnerships and relationships with executive teams in EMEA to create meaningful agendas for executive engagements, and ensure the appropriate internal participants are included.
  • Plan strategic engagements between Google executives and government officials/business stakeholders, including event planning and coordination. Support external facing strategic outreach efforts, such as campaigns, in-region executive visits, and roadshows.
  • Play a key role in coordinating, composing, and editing written materials, such as briefing documents, letters, and talking points. Manage the cross-functional process for development, tracking, and updating of the stakeholder engagement list.
  • Support the GAPP team in public affairs operations and projects.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in government or public policy.
  • Experience planning and/or executing events.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to grow and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to condense complex written materials into concise talking points.
  • Ability to identify opportunities and areas for improvement, and to operate in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to collaborate with multiple teams concurrently.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, strategic, and analytical skills.

address_lines: Six Pancras Square, 6 Pancras Square, London N1C 4AG, UK

jobs.description:
We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution, and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas.

Along with the team, you will provide business critical insights using analytics, ensuring cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and help teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. You will focus on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

As the Strategic Outreach and Engagement Manager, you will closely collaborate with the Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team in implementing local engagement programs in United Kingdom.

Google takes its responsibilities seriously, including engaging with government and other stakeholders on important public policy challenges. The Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team leads the company’s engagement with executive branch officials, legislators, regulators and third-parties in the formation of public policy. Working closely with Google leaders, GAPP seeks to identify key policy issues, listen carefully to others’ views and opinions, and distill and share the company’s perspective on those issues with external stakeholders. While we focus on challenges affecting the internet, our issue areas are increasingly broad and encompass many areas where public policy, business, and technology intersect.

jobs.title: Program Manager, Geo Transportation and Auto
jobs.responsibilities:
• Work closely with software engineers, product managers and other engineering teams to get high-quality products and features through the software project lifecycle
  • Manage program/project schedules, identify possible issues, and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders
  • Work with engineering teams to track their work, capture status and identify risks
  • Report feature/program status to stakeholders and tracking of all cross-team dependencies
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field (e.g., mathematics, natural sciences, engineering, etc.), or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in program or technical management working with cross-functional teams.
  • 3 years of experience in program managing software programs through the entire lifecycle

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in release management for software engineering projects.
  • Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical audiences, spanning organizational levels
  • Excellent drive, a collaborative method of working, and experience delivering complex systems on time.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills for overall program, schedules, quality, and progress across multiple teams.

address_lines: lvl 26/1 Bligh St, Sydney NSW 2000, Australia

jobs.description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

The mission of the Geo Auto team is to make driving safe and easy, as a critical pillar in the Transportation mission to improve people’s lives by making cities’ transportation better.

As a Program Manager, you will help develop and maintain the next generation embedded navigation features as part of Google Auto Services.

Geo builds the most accurate, comprehensive, and useful maps for our users. More than a billion people rely on Google Maps services to explore the world and navigate their daily lives. That includes sailing down the Amazon river, choosing where to get a bite of pizza, and saving time in commuting.

Geo also helps merchants get their businesses on Google, and developers use the power of Google Maps to enhance their apps and websites. They are solving complex computer science problems, designing beautiful and intuitive product experiences, and improving the accuracy of our geo data, all in order to plot a course for the future of mapping.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Self-Service Support, Google Cloud
jobs.responsibilities:
• Define the product vision and strategy for our business self-service support, and bring a spirit of innovation and rapid experimentation to deliver an outstanding omni-channel customer experience for self-service
  • Design and lead a multi­-year roadmap, balancing short­-term versus long-term goals and investments to scale globally, and engage regularly as a trusted advisor with business leaders to understand their strategy, business processes, pain points, and priorities to make informed decisions on product strategy while providing transparency into roadmap and status of committed deliverables
  • Partner closely with Engineering, UX, Enterprise Architecture, and other internal Google teams to deliver product success
  • Analyze competitors and industry trends to advance our products and drive innovation
  • Foster and facilitate a highly collaborative work environment to enable timely decision-making across a broad network of stakeholders, delivery partners, and operational teams
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience
  • 10 years of experience developing/launching products/technologies
  • Experience driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions
  • Experience creating product roadmaps, and working with cross-functional teams

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with self-service technologies and products
  • Experience developing/launching products/technologies within one or more of the following: cloud, SaaS, enterprise, internal tools with a focus on CRM/Customer Experience
  • Experience understanding business needs, analyzing opportunities and costs, developing return on investment models, driving product vision, designing and launching products, and ensuring successful user adoption and value realization
  • Experience with Salesforce and Service Cloud
  • Experience managing ecosystems of both custom and third party enterprise applications

address_lines: 201 Spear St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA

jobs.description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

As a Product Manager on the Google Cloud Systems Customer Experience team, you will drive the technology vision and strategy for self-service in our global product support organization.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary of $168,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

jobs.title: Strategic Outreach and Engagement Manager
jobs.responsibilities:
• Develop and execute a strategy for consistent and meaningful engagement with key stakeholders (e.g., policymakers, think tanks, non-governmental organizations, academics, business customers, industry leaders, etc.) in France.
  • Develop cross-functional partnerships and relationships with executive teams in EMEA to create meaningful agendas for executive engagements, and ensure the appropriate internal participants are included.
  • Plan and execute strategic engagements between Google executives and government officials/business stakeholders in France. Support externally facing strategic outreach efforts, such as campaigns, in-region executive visits, and roadshows.
  • Play a key role in coordinating, composing, consolidating, and editing written materials, such as briefing documents, letters, and talking points.
  • Manage the cross-functional process for development, tracking, and updating of the France stakeholder engagement list.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in government or public policy.
  • Experience planning and/or executing events.
  • Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to identify opportunities and areas for improvement, and to operate in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to condense complex written materials into concise talking points.
  • Ability to grow and succeed in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to collaborate with multiple teams concurrently.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, strategic, and analytical skills.
jobs.description:
We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution, and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas.

Along with the team, you will provide business critical insights using analytics, ensuring cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and help teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. You will focus on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. As the Strategic Outreach and Engagement Manager, you will closely collaborate with the Government Affairs and Public Policy team in implementing local engagement programs in France.

Google takes its responsibilities seriously, including engaging with government and other stakeholders on important public policy challenges. The Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team leads the company’s engagement with executive branch officials, legislators, regulators and third-parties in the formation of public policy. Working closely with Google leaders, GAPP seeks to identify key policy issues, listen carefully to others’ views and opinions, and distill and share the company’s perspective on those issues with external stakeholders. While we focus on challenges affecting the internet, our issue areas are increasingly broad and encompass many areas where public policy, business, and technology intersect.

jobs.title: Trends Manager, YouTube Shorts
jobs.responsibilities:
• Manage a global programming coordination effort, reviewing and organizing popular videos and trends each day while taking into account policies and considerations.
  • Be an expert on the latest memes, hit songs, and content trends, tracking breakout hashtags and creators on a daily basis.
  • Leverage data to analyze the audience, grow program strategies, and support marketing and communication initiatives with culture and trends research. Translate video data into cultural insights for internal marketing, public relations, and partnership teams.
  • Represent YouTube occasionally as a spokesperson or by delivering presentations about local trends to internal and external audiences.
  • Assess and make decisions about the appropriateness of different content for various audiences and provide an expert view on cultural sensitivities.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in a creative/editorial role for a brand or platform telling stories related to web content, pop culture, music, or news.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working in breaking news environments or social media companies, with a remit to track and identify memes, songs, and trends.
  • Experience public speaking in a professional capacity.
  • Ability to effectively operate in a fast-paced environment and work on multiple projects simultaneously in a dynamic and constantly evolving context.
  • Ability to build collaborative partnerships cross-functionally, such as across marketing, communications, and engineering.
  • Proficient written and verbal communication skills.
jobs.description:
YouTube Marketing’s mission is to know our users, and to connect them to the magic of our products and creators. We make YouTube successful by shaping people’s perceptions of YouTube and inspiring them to engage with us. We’re also responsible for all of YouTube’s marketing activities to consumers, creators, and key opinion influencers.

As a YouTube Shorts Trends Manager, you will have the opportunity to shape and improve the understanding of YouTube, viral internet culture, trending music, memes, and short-form video content. In this role, you will use data to track trends, and connect YouTube stories and content to people. This includes community-focused initiatives, as well as other projects built around popular content across entertainment, news, music, sports, and more.

You will manage efforts around popular trends, channels, and videos, and develop programming strategies with a focus on short-form video and hashtags, helping support YouTube Shorts. You will leverage data and research to create positive, engaging user experiences on a daily basis, and work with cross-functional teams to help users and creators better understand what's happening on YouTube. You will be immersed in the YouTube community and daily social media conversation.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

jobs.title: Customer Engineering Manager, Google Cloud
jobs.responsibilities:
• Lead, inspire, and grow a team of Customer Engineers across the region who engage with prospects, provide technical discovery and solutions recommendations while working in partnership with customers, and manage and motivate a diverse collection of engineering professionals.
  • Contribute to building a business that promotes excellent growth and maintain motivation in order to work effectively in a dynamic environment.
  • Engage directly with prospects regarding architecture discussions and best practices.
  • Work cross-functionally with our Product, Support, Engineering, and Sales teams to make compelling presentations and use excellent verbal and written communication skills to represent the capabilities and services of Google Cloud.
  • Hire, coach, and drive a team to deliver against assigned strategic goals, and prioritize the delivery of an excellent customer experience.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience as a technical sales engineer in cloud computing or experience in a customer-facing role on a professional services/systems engineering team.
  • Experience with IaaS, PaaS, Big Data, SaaS, public cloud, and related industry/technical concepts.
  • Experience developing, growing, and managing teams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science and/or MBA.
  • 5 years of managing large scale cloud teams with strong experience working with customers across Singapore and Malaysia.
  • Knowledge of solution architecture within web/mobile, web/internet technologies, and architecture across SaaS/PaaS/IaaS and cloud productivity.
  • Proven track record of working with customers in Singapore and Malaysia across the Enterprises and Digital Natives space and startups at the CXO and founder level.
  • Ability to inspire/grow sales teams and work with cross-functional teams to achieve common business objectives.
  • Ability to operate in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
jobs.description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Customer Engineering Manager, you will lead a team of customer engineers who engage with prospects and channel partners to understand and assess customer requirements, prepare and present demonstrations of Google Cloud technologies, and address and overcome technical objections that arise throughout the business process. You will lead efforts to drive solution innovation, working across the organization to identify the assets and tools to drive customer adoption. You will be responsible for investing in team development and success, building a high-performing, effective and collaborative team.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

jobs.title: Supplier Development Engineer, Pixel Display
jobs.responsibilities:
• Be responsible for display and touch technology feasibility studies through theoretical simulation and practical engineering methods, and for design and development of technically complex manufacturing processes to enable new products designs and functional requirements.
  • Provide technical direction to suppliers to establish and validate (utilizing statistical tools) process capability during NPI phase for consistently delivering quality products in mass production.
  • Drive project technical and operational issues wrt material, process, fixtures, equipment etc. during NPI phase to enable the delivery of a mature product and manufacturing process into Mass Production.
  • Engage in development activities working with cross functional product teams in identifying and resolving technical/process issues, early detection and highlighting quality risks to core teams.
  • Publish reports on supplier performance based on production line statistics in the factory and field and plans on addressing any issues.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in manufacturing, process and/or quality engineering.
  • Experience working with OLED display modules and their manufacturing and assembly processes.
  • Experience in process engineering; developing and scaling manufacturing and test processes.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience managing functional engineering teams.
  • Project management experience including data handling, documentation, and organization.
  • Experience launching new products for Contract Manufacturers and Original Device Manufacturers.
  • Knowledge of quality and statistical tools and methods.
  • Organized and methodical with excellent communication skills.
jobs.description:
Google has one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. Your team is responsible for providing the manufacturing capability to deliver this state-of-the-art physical infrastructure. As a Manufacturing Engineer, you evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools and procedures behind Google's powerful search technology. When vendors build parts for our infrastructure, you're right there alongside ensuring manufacturing processes are repeatable and controlled. You collaborate with Commodity Managers and Design Engineers to determine Google's infrastructure needs and product specifications. Your work ensures the various pieces of Google's infrastructure fit together perfectly and keep our systems humming along smoothly for a seamless user experience.

In this role, you'll engage in development activities working with cross-functional Product teams in understanding and resolving technical issues, early detection, and highlighting quality risks to core teams and management. You will be responsible for sensor assembly manufacturing and testing processes. You'll also lead the design and development of technically complex manufacturing processes to enable new product designs and functional requirements.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
jobs.application_instruction:
For immediate consideration, please send a text (ASCII), HTML, PDF or DOC version of your resume in English to jobs@google.com.

Important: The subject field of your email must include Supplier Development Engineer, Pixel Display - Shenzhen.

  • Work closely with Strategy & Operations leads and cross-functional team members to develop and deploy collateral materials, speeches, and policy briefings that can improve external stakeholder trust and perception.

  • Knowledge of current and emerging public policy trends and related key stakeholders in Europe.

address_lines: Six Pancras Square, 6 Pancras Square, London N1C 4AG, UK

jobs.description:
The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) organization ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.

The Business Strategy & Operations team provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

As an Operations and Communications Specialist, you will closely collaborate with the Government Affairs & Public Policy (GAPP) leadership team to deliver on key strategic projects, run operations and get results. You will also support the development of high quality written products for policy purposes in coordination with EMEA Comms and GAPP Global Visits teams. The role requires attention to detail, a proactive mindset, a get-things-done attitude, and the ability to communicate effectively across teams and with people from around the world.

Google takes its responsibilities seriously, including engaging with government and other stakeholders on important public policy challenges. The Government Affairs and Public Policy (GAPP) team leads the company’s engagement with executive branch officials, legislators, regulators and third-parties in the formation of public policy. Working closely with Google leaders, GAPP seeks to identify key policy issues, listen carefully to others’ views and opinions, and distill and share the company’s perspective on those issues with external stakeholders. While we focus on challenges affecting the internet, our issue areas are increasingly broad and encompass many areas where public policy, business, and technology intersect.

jobs.title: Employee Relations Care Specialist (Fixed-Term Contract)
jobs.responsibilities:
• Work occasional non-standard US hours as needed.
  • Provide guidance to a diverse audience on a wide range of potentially sensitive, confidential and difficult topics with empathy, discretion, and active listening skills to create an inclusive, psychologically safe and open setting.
  • Serve as a neutral, trusted resource who can understand and help Googlers identify and address their care and well-being needs, whilst also encouraging agency; apply appropriate HR processes and Google business processes knowledge.
  • Maintain program administration and confidential records regarding utilization and efficacy.
  • Share insights and analysis with the global team for ongoing cross-training, program improvements and aggregate reporting.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of Human Resources experience, including experience with investigations/complaint procedures/case management/program management.
  • Experience managing employee relations cases/issues.
  • Ability to work non-standard work hours to accommodate regional coverage requests.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Coaching or counseling experience on sensitive people matters.
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment and decision-making.
  • Ability to build trust and rapport across diverse audiences.
  • Excellent communication skills with a particular focus on empathetic listening, conflict resolution, de-escalation and risk mitigation.

address_lines: Google Building GWC1, 2025 Garcia Ave, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA

jobs.description:
As a part of the Googler Experience team within People Operations, we are a forward-thinking Employee Relations team that relies on both our subject matter expertise and empathy to help make a better Google by being there for Googlers in the moments that matter most. The Care Specialist team acts as a neutral, single point of contact for guiding and assisting Googlers with Employee Relations (ER). Care Specialists assess the Googler’s needs, understand Google business processes to access resources, and facilitate care and support. Care Specialists partner with the Googler to support them in their unique experience, identify relevant resources, and help develop a customized care plan as they navigate ER processes.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.
jobs.application_instruction: This role is a 6-month Fixed-Term Contract position.

jobs.title: Product Partnerships Manager, Core, YouTube
jobs.responsibilities:
• Manage partnerships that drive distribution of and access to YouTube’s applications and services, and drive significant awareness and user growth with mobile operator and broadband partners in priority markets in EMEA.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with partners including management, optimization of existing partners, support and track new partners through the launch process, agreement facilitations, and liaise with YouTube product and technical support teams that may be in other regions.
  • Work with your YouTube Product and Content Partnership colleagues, and colleagues in other Google functions to define and execute country strategy to accelerate growth as new initiatives arise.
  • Execute scalable user acquisition through partnerships and marketing programs.
  • Define, analyze, and communicate partner metrics and develop account plans for presentation to YouTube management and partners.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Relevant experience in front line client facing business development roles.
  • Experience in the telecom, media, and technology sector in developed markets including Germany and the United Kingdom.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Management consulting or corporate strategy experience.
  • Experience working on agreements and managing relationships with the major telecom operators and original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) in Western Europe, Russia, and Turkey, developing detailed account plans.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships across departments including sales, marketing, business development, engineering, and product management.
  • Strong understanding of mobile and broadband business models and priorities for partners.
  • Strategic, structured thinker with the ability to articulate new concepts and business models to a global cross-functional team.
jobs.description:
YouTube’s Product Partnerships team accelerates the global growth and innovation of YouTube products by driving new business opportunities through partnerships. We own the business side of new features, products and initiatives that are vital to the success of YouTube. As a team member, you understand the landscape of partnerships opportunities across technology licensing/integrations, marketing, and distribution. You will also craft strategies, define and structure critical partnerships, negotiate agreements, and cultivate our relationships.

As a Product Partnerships Manager, you will help drive YouTube’s growth across EMEA, with particular focus on key developed markets including Germany and the UK, and developing markets including Russia and Turkey. Additionally, as the team representative based in Germany, you will play a secondary role of country lead, helping define YouTube's Germany partnerships strategy for each of the Core product areas.

You’ll work with our partners on product launches, product integration, marketing campaigns, feature requests, and strategic planning to drive successful partner implementations and increase user adoption and awareness of YouTube products. You will also manage business creation and growth with our partners as part of our next generation implementations. In addition, you will also work with the Global team using your insights and perspectives from local markets, to support global initiatives.

You will work autonomously to close agreements and also collaboratively with cross-functional teams to initiate, support, and grow partners and YouTube’s business.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

jobs.summary:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Relevant experience in front line client facing business development roles.
  • Experience in the telecom, media, and technology sector in developed markets including Germany and the United Kingdom.

jobs.title: Director, Security & Trust Center (STC), Google Cloud
jobs.responsibilities:
• Provide customer security teams assistance when incidents occur, collaborating within security and with technical and executive leadership.
  • Leverage Google’s threat intelligence capabilities, provide insights to the customers’ operations to help prepare for pertinent threats, develop effective countermeasures, and perform their defense and co-governance roles in Cloud more effectively.
  • Ensure top cloud fraud and abuse risks are anticipated and effectively mitigated, staying abreast of emerging trends and working with engineering to develop detective and preventive controls.
  • Coordinate security response preparedness drills and maintain continuous threat and attack visibility for Cloud products and services, partnering with cross-functional engineering teams drive detection, intelligence, and response capabilities, representing the views of Cloud CISO.
  • Engage with internal partners in Sales, Office of the CISO, etc. to share recommended practices and insights though executive briefings, conferences, and similar forums.
jobs.qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience with 10 years in security operations, incident response, information security, fraud, threat intelligence, or privacy.
  • 5 years of experience managing dispersed technical teams.
  • Experience communicating and promoting business or technical concepts with senior leadership.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience securing systems in Cloud and hybrid environments, including threat intelligence in defensive operations, malware, attacker techniques, and offensive security.
  • Experience working with engineering teams to drive improvements at scale, building security capabilities, and shaping Cloud detection and mitigation strategies.
  • Experience with regulated environments, international privacy regimes, including associated incident management and reporting.
  • Experience with digital forensics, evidence, working with legal teams, and investigating and remediating nation state intrusions or large eCrime cases at enterprises.
  • Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills including technical writing and building relationships with and influence savvy internal and external stakeholders.

address_lines: Google Building TC3, 805 11th Ave, Sunnyvale, CA 94089, USA

jobs.description:
The Google Cloud CISO team is the integrated risk, security, compliance, and privacy team. In partnership with the wider teams in Alphabet, our mission is to: Secure the Cloud (especially Google Cloud), Secure the Customer (shared responsibility to shared fate), Secure the Planet (and beyond).

We view security as an all encompassing goal that includes all forms of risk, immense focus on information/cybersecurity, helping assure we and our customers remain in compliance with all the related certifications and regulations and driving our intense dedication to customer and user privacy.

As Director, Security and Trust Center (STC), Google Cloud, within the Google Cloud CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) function, you will be responsible for the engagement with customer security teams and external partners in the areas of security response, fraud, abuse, and threat intelligence.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
